title: Gogglebox's Scarlett Moffatt admits she is 'gutted' at family's axe | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news caroline westbrook for metro.co.uk

text:
Caroline Westbrook for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 7:51 am Scarlett is heading for Saturday Night Takeaway (Picture: ITV) Scarlett Moffatt has broken her silence over her familyâ€™s axing from Gogglebox, admitting she is â€˜guttedâ€™.
The reality star is moving on to pastures new in the wake of her Iâ€™m A Celebrity win, joining Ant and Dec in the new series of Saturday Night Takeaway this weekend. 
However she has revealed how upset she is that parents Betty and Mark and little sister Ava wonâ€™t appear in the Channel 4 show when the new episodes kick off on February 24. . @DanixRx we are gutted to, thought my Mam and dad (and little Ava) would still be able to do it ðŸ˜¢ but we will still be watching #gogglebox https://t.co/z2Q2anBiyN 
â€” Scarlett Moffatt (@ScarlettMoffatt) February 20, 2017 
â€˜We are gutted,â€™ she said in response to a fan on Twitter, â€˜thought my mam and dad and little Ava would still be able to do it, but we will still be watching.â€™ 

She also took to Instagram, saying they were â€˜going to miss the series so muchâ€™ alongside a snap of her and her parents at the recent National Television Awards. A post shared by Scarlett Moffatt (@scarlett_moffatt) on Feb 20, 2017 at 9:11am PST 
The Moffatts did not feature in the last series of the show either as it clashed with Scarlettâ€™s appearance in Iâ€™m A Celebrity.
